item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (182 points | 31 comments)
2. The age of average (2023) (97 points | 51 comments)
3. Show HN: I designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder (208 points | 106 comments)
4. Fixing the Loading in Myst IV: Revelation (100 points | 10 comments)
5. A transformer supply crisis bottlenecks energy projects (61 points | 46 comments)
6. Elixir/Erlang Hot Swapping Code (2016) (156 points | 67 comments)
7. Clio: A system for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use (58 points | 15 comments)
8. Librebooting the ThinkPad T480 (33 points | 13 comments)
9. What every systems programmer should know about concurrency (2020) [pdf] (49 points | 10 comments)
10. Microsoft GW-Basic User's Guide and Reference (1989) [pdf] (31 points | 13 comments)
11. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (900 points | 137 comments)
12. C++ exception performance three years later (21 points | 8 comments)
13. Taming LLMs – A Practical Guide to LLM Pitfalls with Open Source Software (115 points | 18 comments)
14. Mathematicians uncover a new way to count prime numbers (71 points | 42 comments)
15. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it's going (317 points | 142 comments)
16. Why do animals adopt? (19 points | 16 comments)
17. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history (967 points | 404 comments)
18. When the future arrived, it felt ordinary (25 points | 3 comments)
19. Unexpected Keyboard (196 points | 96 comments)
20. Mastering Ruby Debugging: From Puts to Professional Tools (9 points | discuss)
21. Rust's Incremental Compiler Architecture (56 points | 12 comments)
22. The secret life of DNS packets (2019) (60 points | 7 comments)
23. A new timeline for Neanderthal interbreeding with modern humans (60 points | 33 comments)
24. A room temperature Li2O-based lithium-air battery enabled by a solid electrolyte (91 points | 43 comments)
25. Bitbanging 1D Reversible Automata (78 points | 18 comments)
26. Converting untrusted PDFs into trusted ones: The Qubes Way (2013) (96 points | 35 comments)
27. Show HN: Lfi – a lazy functional sync, async, and concurrent iteration library (74 points | 19 comments)
28. Saving Voyager 1 [video] (11 points | 3 comments)
29. Scrabble star wins Spanish world title despite not speaking Spanish (93 points | 77 comments)
30. Programming Language Memory Models (2021) (104 points | 24 comments)
